meanings.definition: A situation that is difficult or troublesome.
meanings.sent1: Dealing with all the paperwork at the office can be a hassle.
meanings.sent2: Moving to a new house can sometimes be a hassle with all the packing and unpacking.
meanings.sent3: Trying to find a missing sock in the laundry can turn into a real hassle.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam was a hassle that seemed to stretch on forever.
meanings.sent5: The maze at the amusement park was a hassle to navigate through.

meanings.sent1: Please don't hassle your little brother while he's studying.
meanings.sent2: The persistent salesperson continued to hassle me even after I said I wasn't interested.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy would hassle the cat by chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the mosquito would hassle me every night.
meanings.sent5: The noisy neighbors would hassle everyone in the building with their loud music.

meanings.definition: To argue or fight with someone.
meanings.sent1: I don't want to hassle with my friend over such a small matter.
meanings.sent2: The siblings would often hassle over who got to use the computer first.
meanings.sent3: The two politicians would hassle during the debate, trying to prove their points.
meanings.sent4: The kids would hassle over who got the bigger slice of cake.
meanings.sent5: The players on the opposing teams would hassle each other during the game.
